benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered: Valid Deletion scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07)
Query Parameter variations (TC02, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC13, TC18, TC16)
Authorization scenarios (TC11 missing header, TC12 unauthorized token, TC03 with header)
Error handling for invalid inputs (TC08 invalid paymentId format, TC13 invalid customField format, TC16 mixed valid/invalid IDs, TC17 XSS header)
Non-existent resource handling (TC09 non-existent paymentId, TC10 non-existent customField IDs)
Edge/integration scenarios (TC21 audit log available, TC22 audit log unavailable, TC23 backward compatibility)
Large payload and performance (TC06 with 100, TC15 with 1000, TC19 slow/degraded system)
gaps: Rate Limiting: no tests validating rate limiting or throttling under bursty traffic
Caching Behavior: no tests around caching headers like ETag or Cache-Control
Pagination considerations: not applicable for delete of fields but no explicit pagination tests beyond large field sets; explicit pagination testing is absent
Soft Delete semantics: no explicit check whether deletions are soft or hard (though 204 with empty body implies hard delete), ambiguity remains
Conformance to 403 vs 401 distinctions: some scenarios cover 400/401/403 but explicit 403 case for forbidden authenticated user is not clearly tested
Race conditions: no dedicated tests for concurrent deletions or race conditions beyond basic scenarios (TC21/22 touch integration but not concurrent access)
recommendations: Add a dedicated rate-limiting/throttling test to ensure the API handles bursts without errors (e.g., multiple rapid DELETE calls with same/different paymentIds).
Add caching validation tests to verify that responses include appropriate caching headers when applicable (ETag, Cache-Control).
Introduce explicit pagination-related tests only if the API grows to return a paginated list of fields after deletions; currently not required but prepare for future changes.
Clarify and test soft-delete behavior if applicable; document whether custom fields are permanently removed or marked as deleted, and add a test accordingly.
Include an explicit 403 Forbidden test to cover authorized-but-not-allowed scenarios (distinct from 401/400 cases) to ensure proper authorization handling across all paths.
Add a targeted race-condition scenario where two clients attempt to delete the same set of fields concurrently to verify idempotency and correct error handling.
